issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Testing min max w/ 4.0 and seeing the request to run min:x - max:y  fail when 'y' instances/resource slots are not available in the cluster. 

{code}
[root@b-01 ~]# euca-describe-images emi-7a543929

{code}
fields.summary: Instance Reservation min-max failing when max is not available

comments.body:
System info:
Version     : 4.0.1
Release     : 0.0.22242.32.20140719git8e41630.el6

10.111.1.1	CENTOS	6.5	64	REPO	[CLC WS OSG UI]

10.111.5.59	CENTOS	6.5	64	REPO	[NC00]
10.111.5.60	CENTOS	6.5	64	REPO	[CC01 SC01]
10.111.5.69	VMWARE	ESXI-5.1	64	REPO	[NC01]

[~mclark], this appears to work for me. Is it possible you were running out of some other resource (such as private network indexes) and ran into EUCA-9449?

{code}
# euca-describe-instance-types --show-capacity
INSTANCETYPE	Name         CPUs  Memory (MiB)  Disk (GiB)  Used / Total  Used %
INSTANCETYPE	m1.small        1           256           5     4 /     8     50%
INSTANCETYPE	t1.micro        1           256           5     4 /     8     50%
INSTANCETYPE	m1.medium       1           512          10     2 /     5     40%
INSTANCETYPE	c1.medium       2           512          10     2 /     4     50%
INSTANCETYPE	m1.large        2           512          10     2 /     4     50%
INSTANCETYPE	m1.xlarge       2          1024          10     2 /     4     50%

INSTANCETYPE	m2.xlarge       2          2048          10     1 /     3     33%
INSTANCETYPE	m3.xlarge       4          2048          15     1 /     2     50%
INSTANCETYPE	m2.2xlarge      2          4096          30     0 /     1      0%
INSTANCETYPE	m3.2xlarge      4          4096          30     0 /     1      0%
INSTANCETYPE	cc1.4xlarge     8          3072          60     0 /     0        
INSTANCETYPE	m2.4xlarge      8          4096          60     0 /     0

# 
# euca-run-instances -g foo -n 2-6 -z PARTI00 emi-b025ecf1
RESERVATION	r-48a2fe73	568010043949	foo
INSTANCE	i-ceed44b5	emi-b025ecf1			pending		0		m1.small	2014-12-02T01:54:53.464Z	PARTI00				monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			instance-store					hvm			sg-8ee3eff4			
INSTANCE	i-a1e63848	emi-b025ecf1			pending		1		m1.small	2014-12-02T01:54:53.497Z	PARTI00				monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			instance-store					hvm			sg-8ee3eff4			
INSTANCE	i-36e56bbd	emi-b025ecf1			pending		2		m1.small	2014-12-02T01:54:53.527Z	PARTI00				monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			instance-store					hvm			sg-8ee3eff4			
INSTANCE	i-37df5940	emi-b025ecf1			pending		3		m1.small	2014-12-02T01:54:53.559Z	PARTI00				monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			instance-store					hvm			sg-8ee3eff4

I think this was the same issue as EUCA-9449.

This is working for me as well, EUCA-9449 will be tested as a separate issue.
{code}
